jobfair_list.name: Sysco Atlanta - Hiring Event
jobfair_list.location:
Wingate by Wyndham Atlanta
    7882 Senoia Rd




Fairburn, GA 30213
jobfair_list.description:
Sysco Atlanta  Hiring Event! Offers on the Spot!
We will be holding interviews for the following positions:


Outbound Order Selector
-
$17.00 / hour, Full-time



We will be hiring for the following location:

Sysco Atlanta - 2225 Riverdale Rd, College Park,  30337


Requirements

18+ yrs old
Warehouse experience preferred
Be able to lift up to 100 lbs.

How to prepare
The entire interview process will last about 1 hr. Completing our online application online application prior to the event is strongly encouraged and will speed up the process. Please bring 1 form of ID with you to the event.
What to wear
Dress code is Casual (come as you are, but please be presentable).
About the Company
At Sysco, we offer our associates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations. We are looking for talented, hard-working individuals to join our team. Come grow with us and let us show you why good things really do come from Sysco.
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

    This is an ad, and the event is hosted by a third-party. Indeed makes no guarantees about the accuracy of the ad's details.

jobfair_list.name: Veterans Resource Expo 2018
jobfair_list.location:
Atlanta City Hall
68 Mitchell Street Southwest
Atlanta, GA 30303
jobfair_list.description:
A free event sponsored by Council Member Carla Smith in Partnership with the Atlanta Commission on Veteran’s Affairs Commemorating Veteran’s Day 2018 in the city of Atlanta, a community-driven initiative during Hunger and Homelessness Awareness Week, providing Atlanta veterans and their families access to a broad range of services and supplies – such as food, housing assistance, clothing, education assistance, jobs and job training, health screenings and benefits counseling – all in one convenient location, providing access for those with disabilities or limited economic and transportation issues.
Featuring free breakfast, clothes, job opportunities, continuing education counseling, housing information, health screenings, benefits counseling, and much more!
This Veteran’s Fair has the potential to reach a great many veterans, as there are 45,734 veterans living in Fulton County according to the VA Predictive Analytics and Actuary Service (VetPop 2016). All Veterans, active military, transitioning military and those who support Veterans are invited.
Supported by the Atlanta VAMS, the Georgia Department of Veterans Service, other government agencies and community based service providers.
You are welcome to join our online community at http://facebook.com/AtlantaVeteransCommission

jobfair_list.name: Atlanta Job Fair/Interview Event - NOVEMBER 28, 2018 - All Sales Positions
jobfair_list.description:
NOT YOUR TYPICAL JOB FAIR! Sales Jobs Network specializes in providing a personalized, private interview experience for sales-specific positions in varying levels and industries.
Avoid noisy ballrooms and impersonal job fairs. By attending our event, you will receive quality interviews in a one-on-one setting.
EVENT DETAILS:
Wednesday, November 28th, 9:00am-1:00pEmbassy Suites- Perimeter Center1030 Crowne Point ParkwayAtlanta, GA 30338
WHAT TO EXPECT: When you arrive, our event facilitator will educate you on the details of each company and position. You will also receive an Event Program providing additional information on the opportunities. You then choose which companies you would like to interview with. Interviews take place directly with the hiring manager for each company in their PRIVATE suite. Some employers have made offers on the spot!
Many opportunities include base salaries, bonus, commission, health, dental, and life insurance, 401(k) plans with company matches, company cars/allowances.
Whether you are looking to get into sales, or make the next move in your sales career, this is an event you won't want to miss. Stop sending countless online resumes and make your first impression in person!

jobfair_list.name: Joint Executive and Working Professional MBA Forum - Atlanta
jobfair_list.description:
Joint Executive and Working Professional MBA Forum - Atlanta
We know thinking about going back to school is overwhelming, especially when you already have a full-time job and you’re considering a variety of MBA options. Did you know there are a variety of MBA program formats that allow you to continue to work and maintain your current career trajectory, even relocate – and still earn your MBA?
Please join us for a unique evening featuring top MBA programs for working professionals. Come learn about the many different program formats (executive, global, part-time, evening and more), admission requirements, and program focuses available to you. At the event, you will have the opportunity to meet with Admissions Officers and alumni from each school. Have your questions answered by those who have lived it, and receive guidance on the admission process.
Wednesday, November 28, 2018
6:30 – 8:30 pm (registration opens at 6:00 pm)
Atlanta Fish Market
265 Pharr Road NE
Atlanta, GA 30305
Schools Represented:
Emory University - Goizueta Business School
University of North Carolina – Kenan Flagler Business School
Vanderbilt University - Owen Graduate School of Management
Wake Forest University School of Business
Agenda
6:00 – 6:30 pm - Registration
6:30 – 7:00 pm – Admissions Officers presentations
7:00 – 7:30 pm – Alumni Panel
7:30 – 8:30 pm – MBA Fair (light refreshments served)
We look forward to seeing you!

jobfair_list.name: JOB/CAREER FAIR VIPKID COACHING: MAKE $22/HR FROM HOME - NEED BACHELORS ATL
jobfair_list.location:
MicroTek Atlanta
1000 Abernathy Road NE
Atlanta, GA 30328
jobfair_list.description:
PLEASE READ COMPLETELY BEFORE REGISTERING:
WANT TO MAKE $22/HR ASAP??? INTERESTED IN WORKING FROM THE COMFORT OF YOUR HOME???WORK AS MUCH OR AS LITTLE AS YOU LIKE! PART-TIME/FULL-TIME! NO HOURLY MINIMUMS OR MAXIMUMS!!!REGISTER FOR YOUR COACHING CLASS TODAY!!!
PREPARATIONS: Make sure you are qualifiedIn order to qualify for this coaching day, you must have the following:- A Bachelor's Degree or higher in ANY field- One year of teaching experience which can include Summer Camp, Private Tutoring, Sunday School, etc.- Must be legally eligible to work in the U.S. or Canada
Once you have read and understood the opportunity please complete the following steps:1. Acquire your Eventbrite Ticket (ensure your email, event location and time are correct)2. Wait for an email from "VIPKID Get Hired Now" to complete your application*** PLEASE NOTE - If you have applied to VIPKID in the past, you ARE eligible to take this Coaching Class, BUT you must register on Eventbrite with a DIFFERENT email address than the one you've used with VIPKID ***
What should you expect?:Learn more about this fast growing company and how we are making a global impact. We have over 40,000 teachers in our community and you will see first hand what its like to be a VIPKID teacher.Watch VIPKID Instructors demonstrate key skills for teaching ESL online. This includes Total Physical Response, Energy, Phonics, Student Output, and Appropriate Language. We will also practice pacing, & reward systems.Work with current VIPKID teachers and mentors and get live feedback on what to practice and work on before your Mock Class. You will get a chance to see current teachers in their online classrooms!
What To Bring
-Please bring a laptop with video camera (we will have some for your use if you cannot bring your own)-Update your flash and chrome browser-You do not need to bring a resume or any documents-Casual attire-There will be snacks, coffee, and beverages provided as well - no lunch. We will take breaks throughout the day.-We love kids, but we are unable to provide accommodations for children during the session.
Next Steps after Coaching DayYou will leave with a Mock Class scheduled for the following week. This is the last stage of interview process - you will do it from home, on your own internet connection.
How Long is Coaching Day?Coaching Day is 4 hours. You will learn, practice, and get access to resources and teachers that you can't find online.
The VIPKID Online opportunity - Please read complete description.
Looking for a flexible, professional online opportunity? VIPKID is the world leader in online English education for kids 12 and under.
Rediscover the joy of teaching with VIPKID's platform and curriculum. No commute, no grading, no lesson planning required! Instruct kids in your spare time during early mornings or evenings.
Teaching just 1-3 hours part-time per day earns you between $1,300-$2,700 a month. It's as easy as making a Skype call, with interactive and fun curriculum and lesson plans made for your use.
- Ranked #2 by Forbes on its 2017 "Top 100 Remote Work" companies- The most active online English teaching community in the world- Top-ranked online teaching company on Indeed and Glassdoor with 4-star rating and 86% CEO approval- Backed by Sequoia Capital and Tencent Holdings (currently valued at $1.5 billion)
Requirements and Qualifications to become an Online English Teacher/Online ESL Teacher:- Bachelor's Degree or higher- Experience within the U.S./Canadian School System (Taught or Attended)- Eligible to legally work in the U.S. or Canada- Desire to engage and inspire young learners
*Note on Teaching Experience: This can include educators, professors, tutors, teaching assistants, elementary teachers, traditional teaching experience or the equivalent in mentoring, tutoring, or alternative education such as summer counselor or Sunday school teacher. Please list ANY teaching experience available to be considered for an interview.
While helpful, there's no requirement for teaching certificate, state certification, TESOL, TEFL, or ESL experience. All classes and business are conducted in English.
Other experience you may have that are not requirements, but are preferred:- Online English Education / Educator / Online English Teaching / Online Instructor- Home-Based Online English Teacher / Online English Tutor / Online English Tutoring- Online English Teacher Assistant / Online English Elementary Teacher- Summer Teacher / Casual Teacher / Assistant Teacher / Teaching Assistant- Elementary School Teacher / High School Teacher- Substitute Teacher / Teacher Assistant / Lead Teacher
The Basics of the Online English Teacher Role:- The classes: 25-minute full immersion English language, 1-on-1 classes- The pay: Depends on your experience, but as reported on Indeed, averages around $19/hour (for two 25 min. classes)- The curriculum: U.S. Common Core aligned lesson material, designed by our in-house curriculum team- Time of day: You choose your schedule from available class slots; peak student demand hours are listed below- Location: Conveniently teach remote from your own home - no commute!- What you need: You only need is computer, a strong internet connection, and a headset- Benefits: Learn best online teaching experiences from our professional team at no cost- The culture: You will learn about Chinese culture, families, and lifestyle through classroom exchanges with our students
Contract type: Independent contractorStart date: Immediately
Reserve your tickets today through Eventbrite and you will receive an email from us within 24-48 hours to complete your application.
Don't have a Bachelor's Degree, but know someone who does? Make $25 for each successful referral! Email us at: info@VIPKidGetHiredNow.com (Send us their email address once they sign-up. They must complete the interview process and become an employee to be eligible for the $25 referral bonus)

jobfair_list.name: Atlanta Job Fair DECEMBER 11TH! *Sales, Management, Business Development, Marketing
jobfair_list.description:
Are you still looking for that golden career opportunity that will allow you to build a solid future for yourself and your family? United Career Fairs can help! We have over 20 years of experience in connecting candidates just like you with hiring managers at companies ranging from small local businesses clear on up to Fortune 500 corporations. Register now to attend our upcoming career fair!  
Tuesday, December 11th, 2018 – 6pm SharpWyndham Atlanta Galleria6345 Powers Ferry Rd. NWAtlanta, GA 30339
 
 Our career fairs focus specifically on Sales, Business Development, Marketing, Customer Service, and Retail & Sales Management jobs, and offer you individual, face-to-face time with hiring managers from a variety of different companies. All of our events are held in the evening, making it easier to work around your existing job schedule.  Here’s how it works: we will welcome you with a formal executive presentation in which each company will introduce itself and the opportunities they offer. You will then be free to meet with hiring managers from each company that has attracted your interest. At the same time, you will be able to network not only with various employers, but also with other professionals.   Whether you are a seasoned executive-level professional, just beginning your career, or anywhere in between, our events can connect you with as many valuable employer contacts in two hours as you would make in weeks of job searching on your own. Hiring managers will be onsite and ready to offer second interviews to qualified candidates.   Click here to pre-register today and reserve your spot at this exclusive hiring event!  

We encourage professionals of all levels of experience to attend our Career Fair. From entry-level and mid-level (3-10 years of experience) all the way up to C-level, hiring managers are looking for candidates just like you.   In order to make the most of your time at our event and to secure invitations for second interviews from the companies of your choice, you should be prepared to make a positive impression. We recommend that you:  

Arrive at the career fair no later than 6pm
Wear business professional attire
Bring at least 10-15 copies of your updated resume
Display an engaging and motivated attitude

 PLEASE NOTE: You must actually attend the event in order to meet directly with hiring managers and to be considered for their positions.   Typical positions for which employers may interview include: B2B, outside sales representatives, inside sales representatives, b2b sales, account managers, account executives, advertising, marketing, customer service, financial services, telemarketer, management trainee, financial advisor, sales managers, sales directors, telesales, territory sales representatives, insurance sales, pharmaceutical sales, route sales, retail sales representatives, retail sales managers, financial sales and many more!   
United Career Fairs – Uniting Great Companies with Great Candidates!

jobfair_list.name: ALORICA - Hiring Event
jobfair_list.location:
Alorica
    7401 E. Ben White Blvd




Austin , TX 78741
jobfair_list.description:
Alorica One Day Hiring Event - ON THE SPOT Job Offers!
We will be holding interviews for the following positions:


Customer Service Representative
-
Full-time



We will be hiring for the following location:

Alorica, 7401 E. Ben White Blvd, Austin , TX 78741


Requirements

High School Diploma or GED required
Customer Service experience a plus
Phone-related customer service a major plus
Familiarity with Microsoft Windows, Word, and Excel applications
Bilingual language skills a plus

How to prepare
The entire interview process will last about 2 hr. Completing our online application prior to the event is strongly encouraged and will speed up the process. Please bring 2 forms of ID with you to the event.
What to wear
Dress code is Business Casual (slacks, button down, optional tie).
About the Company

Every day, we aim to live up to our mission of creating insanely great customer experiences. But as Alorica employees, giving back matters just as much – that’s why we’re so proud of Making Lives Better with Alorica, a non-profit, 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to providing assistance to employees, their families and the people, organizations and communities who support them.
Simply put, we want to make lives better…one interaction at a time. And to do that, we need the very best people to join us.
But please, allow us to entice you further! As an Alorica employee, you may receive:

Paid training
Flexible training schedule
Medical and dental benefits
Paid time off
Retirement planning options (401(k))
Employee discounts through client programs


Working at Alorica means potentially having the freedom to explore all kinds of career options – from customer service, training, and tech support, to management, recruiting and more. Alorica offers fun, challenging opportunities to pursue your professional goals, and we want you to have fun and succeed – because when you’re at your best, that’s when we’re at our best.
 
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

    This is an ad, and the event is hosted by a third-party. Indeed makes no guarantees about the accuracy of the ad's details.

jobfair_list.name: Capital Factory 2018 Winter Job Fair
jobfair_list.description:
Join us for a 2-hour evening startup mixer focused on connecting Capital Factory companies to individuals seeking employment within the Austin tech and startup community. Come meet our budding startups, learn about what opportunities are available, drop off a resume, and grab yourself a drink. 
This event is FREE and OPEN TO THE PUBLIC.


Who is this event for?
Job hunters, students seeking internships, and more - essentially, those interested in connecting with potential employers.
What is the format of this event?
This format will be an informal version of what one might see during the Austin Startup Crawl. Participants will follow a path that will give them the opportunity to visit each startup. Of course, participants are also welcome to head to specific startup tables.
Help keep this event FREE - become a SPONSOR. 
Recruiters and employers, unite! We hope that you too will join us for an evening of networking. If you sponsor, you'll have a dedicated space, branding on email campaigns surrounding the winter job fair, and a logo added as a sponsor to Eventbrite Page. You'll also get physical branding on all signage, and a social media shout out thanking your company for sponsoring.
If interested, please email partnerships@capitalfactory.com
Schedule
7PM: Check-in, grab a drink, and get ready for things to begin.7:30PM: Get to mixin' and minglin' with our startups!8:30PM: Snag that last business card, drop off your resume, and say goodbye.






Special thanks to our sponsors!

jobfair_list.name: ALORICA - Hiring Event
jobfair_list.location:
Alorica
    7401 E. Ben White Blvd




Austin , TX 78741
jobfair_list.description:
Alorica One Day Hiring Event - ON THE SPOT Job Offers!
We will be holding interviews for the following positions:


Customer Service Representative
-
Full-time



We will be hiring for the following location:

Alorica, 7401 E. Ben White Blvd, Austin , TX 78741


Requirements

High School Diploma or GED required
Customer Service experience a plus
Phone-related customer service a major plus
Familiarity with Microsoft Windows, Word, and Excel applications
Bilingual language skills a plus

How to prepare
The entire interview process will last about 2 hr. Completing our online application prior to the event is strongly encouraged and will speed up the process. Please bring 2 forms of ID with you to the event.
What to wear
Dress code is Business Casual (slacks, button down, optional tie).
About the Company

Every day, we aim to live up to our mission of creating insanely great customer experiences. But as Alorica employees, giving back matters just as much – that’s why we’re so proud of Making Lives Better with Alorica, a non-profit, 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to providing assistance to employees, their families and the people, organizations and communities who support them.
Simply put, we want to make lives better…one interaction at a time. And to do that, we need the very best people to join us.
But please, allow us to entice you further! As an Alorica employee, you may receive:

Paid training
Flexible training schedule
Medical and dental benefits
Paid time off
Retirement planning options (401(k))
Employee discounts through client programs


Working at Alorica means potentially having the freedom to explore all kinds of career options – from customer service, training, and tech support, to management, recruiting and more. Alorica offers fun, challenging opportunities to pursue your professional goals, and we want you to have fun and succeed – because when you’re at your best, that’s when we’re at our best.
 
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

    This is an ad, and the event is hosted by a third-party. Indeed makes no guarantees about the accuracy of the ad's details.

If you are looking for a job in San Antonio Texas this event is one you will not want to miss. Interview with multiple candidates from the cities top employers. Print out multiple resumes, dress your best and land your dream job.

Kohl's Hingham, Hingham,  02043


Requirements

Ability to work as part of a team and interact effectively with others
Effective verbal and written communication skills
Regular attendance
Adherence to Kohl's policy and procedures

How to prepare
The entire interview process will last about 30 min. Completing our online application prior to the event is strongly encouraged and will speed up the process. Please bring your resume with you to the event.
What to wear
Dress code is Business Casual (slacks, button down, optional tie).
About the Company
From our roots in Wisconsin, Kohl’s has grown to become a leading omnichannel retailer with more than 1,100 stores in 49 states, distribution centers across the U.S., a design center in New York City and a technology office in Silicon Valley. What drives our success can’t be replicated – it’s all of our associates nationwide who are united around one common purpose: to inspire and empower families to lead fulfilled lives. It’s our purpose that fuels the passion and desire we have to innovate and deliver amazing products at an incredible value and to provide easy, engaging experiences for our customers.
We know that it’s our people and our culture that makes Kohl’s stand apart. It’s how we live our values to put customers first, act with integrity, build great teams and drive results. We’re also committed to giving back and making a difference in the communities that our customers and associates call home. We’re proud to have given more than $650 million to the communities we serve and the causes our associates care about.
 
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

    This is an ad, and the event is hosted by a third-party. Indeed makes no guarantees about the accuracy of the ad's details.

jobfair_list.name: Boston Job Fair DECEMBER 12TH! *Sales, Management, Business Development, Marketing
jobfair_list.description:
Are you still looking for that golden career opportunity that will allow you to build a solid future for yourself and your family? United Career Fairs can help! We have over 20 years of experience in connecting candidates just like you with hiring managers at companies ranging from small local businesses clear on up to Fortune 500 corporations. Register now to attend our upcoming career fair!  
Wednesday, December 12th, 2018 – 6pm SharpHilton Garden Inn Boston/Waltham450 Totten Pond Rd.Waltham, MA 02451
 
 Our career fairs focus specifically on Sales, Business Development, Marketing, Customer Service, and Retail & Sales Management jobs, and offer you individual, face-to-face time with hiring managers from a variety of different companies. All of our events are held in the evening, making it easier to work around your existing job schedule.  Here’s how it works: we will welcome you with a formal executive presentation in which each company will introduce itself and the opportunities they offer. You will then be free to meet with hiring managers from each company that has attracted your interest. At the same time, you will be able to network not only with various employers, but also with other professionals.   Whether you are a seasoned executive-level professional, just beginning your career, or anywhere in between, our events can connect you with as many valuable employer contacts in two hours as you would make in weeks of job searching on your own. Hiring managers will be onsite and ready to offer second interviews to qualified candidates.   Click here to pre-register today and reserve your spot at this exclusive hiring event!  

We encourage professionals of all levels of experience to attend our Career Fair. From entry-level and mid-level (3-10 years of experience) all the way up to C-level, hiring managers are looking for candidates just like you.   In order to make the most of your time at our event and to secure invitations for second interviews from the companies of your choice, you should be prepared to make a positive impression. We recommend that you:  

Arrive at the career fair no later than 6pm
Wear business professional attire
Bring at least 10-15 copies of your updated resume
Display an engaging and motivated attitude

 PLEASE NOTE: You must actually attend the event in order to meet directly with hiring managers and to be considered for their positions.   Typical positions for which employers may interview include: B2B, outside sales representatives, inside sales representatives, b2b sales, account managers, account executives, advertising, marketing, customer service, financial services, telemarketer, management trainee, financial advisor, sales managers, sales directors, telesales, territory sales representatives, insurance sales, pharmaceutical sales, route sales, retail sales representatives, retail sales managers, financial sales and many more!   
United Career Fairs – Uniting Great Companies with Great Candidates!

jobfair_list.name: Walter E Smithe Furniture and Design - Hiring Event
jobfair_list.location:
Walter E. Smithe Furniture & Design
    177 Army Trail Rd




Glendale Heights, IL 60139
jobfair_list.description:
Walter E Smithe Furniture and Design Hiring Event!
We will be holding interviews for the following positions:


Interior Designer/Sales
-
Full-time



We will be hiring for the following locations:

All locations in the surrounding area of the event location


Requirements

Must be able to demonstrate a passion for design
Prior sales experience of 1-2 years working with clients in high-end, luxury retail
Should have an engaging personal presence – someone who can quickly connect and build rapport

How to prepare
The entire interview process will last about 1 hr. Please bring 1 form of ID and your resume with you to the event.
What to wear
Dress code is Business Casual (slacks, button down, optional tie).
How to get to the event
Plenty of free parking in the lot. We are located in the shopping plaza on the corner of Army Trail Rd and Bloomingdale Rd in Glendale Heights.
About the Company
Walter E. Smithe Furniture & Design is a family-owned furniture retailer, founded right here in Chicago back in 1945. Over the past 73 years, the company has grown to include 10 Chicago area showrooms, with locations in Vernon Hills, Arlington Heights, Old Orchard, Glendale Heights, Geneva, Naperville, Oak Brook, Orland Park, Lincoln Park, Merrillville, IN, as well as our Itasca headquarters. Today, you'll find 3 generations of the Smithe family still actively involved in the business.
Here's why we think Smithe is the BEST place to be a designer
· Flexible Schedules
· 3 Months Paid Training - $10/hour, plus earned commissions
· 100% Commission, paid at order – not delivery
· Bonuses for top performers
· Creative Autonomy
· Access to Design Tools
· Beautiful Showrooms
· Quality Product Lines
· Price Points for every budget
· Dedicated Brand Advertising + Personalized Marketing Support
· Generous Employee Discounts
· Client Service Support Staff
· Benefits Include: Medical, Dental, Vision; Life Insurance (if on medical); Long Term Disability; Employee Assistance Program; 401K; Paid Holidays; Paid Time Off; Opportunities to earn additional bonuses
 
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

    This is an ad, and the event is hosted by a third-party. Indeed makes no guarantees about the accuracy of the ad's details.

jobfair_list.name: JOB/CAREER FAIR VIPKID COACHING: MAKE $22/HR FROM HOME - NEED BACHELORS CHI
jobfair_list.description:
PLEASE READ COMPLETELY BEFORE REGISTERING:
WANT TO MAKE $22/HR ASAP??? INTERESTED IN WORKING FROM THE COMFORT OF YOUR HOME???WORK AS MUCH OR AS LITTLE AS YOU LIKE! PART-TIME/FULL-TIME! NO HOURLY MINIMUMS OR MAXIMUMS!!!REGISTER FOR YOUR COACHING CLASS TODAY!!!
PREPARATIONS: Make sure you are qualifiedIn order to qualify for this coaching day, you must have the following:- A Bachelor's Degree or higher in ANY field- One year of teaching experience which can include Summer Camp, Private Tutoring, Sunday School, etc.- Must be legally eligible to work in the U.S. or Canada
Once you have read and understood the opportunity please complete the following steps:1. Acquire your Eventbrite Ticket (ensure your email, event location and time are correct)2. Wait for an email from "VIPKID Get Hired Now" to complete your application*** PLEASE NOTE - If you have applied to VIPKID in the past, you ARE eligible to take this Coaching Class, BUT you must register on Eventbrite with a DIFFERENT email address than the one you've used with VIPKID ***
What should you expect?:Learn more about this fast growing company and how we are making a global impact. We have over 40,000 teachers in our community and you will see first hand what its like to be a VIPKID teacher.Watch VIPKID Instructors demonstrate key skills for teaching ESL online. This includes Total Physical Response, Energy, Phonics, Student Output, and Appropriate Language. We will also practice pacing, & reward systems.Work with current VIPKID teachers and mentors and get live feedback on what to practice and work on before your Mock Class. You will get a chance to see current teachers in their online classrooms!
What To Bring
-Please bring a laptop with video camera (we will have some for your use if you cannot bring your own)-Update your flash and chrome browser-You do not need to bring a resume or any documents-Casual attire-There will be snacks, coffee, and beverages provided as well - no lunch. We will take breaks throughout the day.-We love kids, but we are unable to provide accommodations for children during the session.
Next Steps after Coaching DayYou will leave with a Mock Class scheduled for the following week. This is the last stage of interview process - you will do it from home, on your own internet connection.
How Long is Coaching Day?Coaching Day is 4 hours. You will learn, practice, and get access to resources and teachers that you can't find online.
The VIPKID Online opportunity - Please read complete description.
Looking for a flexible, professional online opportunity? VIPKID is the world leader in online English education for kids 12 and under.
Rediscover the joy of teaching with VIPKID's platform and curriculum. No commute, no grading, no lesson planning required! Instruct kids in your spare time during early mornings or evenings.
Teaching just 1-3 hours part-time per day earns you between $1,300-$2,700 a month. It's as easy as making a Skype call, with interactive and fun curriculum and lesson plans made for your use.
- Ranked #2 by Forbes on its 2017 "Top 100 Remote Work" companies- The most active online English teaching community in the world- Top-ranked online teaching company on Indeed and Glassdoor with 4-star rating and 86% CEO approval- Backed by Sequoia Capital and Tencent Holdings (currently valued at $1.5 billion)
Requirements and Qualifications to become an Online English Teacher/Online ESL Teacher:- Bachelor's Degree or higher- Experience within the U.S./Canadian School System (Taught or Attended)- Eligible to legally work in the U.S. or Canada- Desire to engage and inspire young learners
*Note on Teaching Experience: This can include educators, professors, tutors, teaching assistants, elementary teachers, traditional teaching experience or the equivalent in mentoring, tutoring, or alternative education such as summer counselor or Sunday school teacher. Please list ANY teaching experience available to be considered for an interview.
While helpful, there's no requirement for teaching certificate, state certification, TESOL, TEFL, or ESL experience. All classes and business are conducted in English.
Other experience you may have that are not requirements, but are preferred:- Online English Education / Educator / Online English Teaching / Online Instructor- Home-Based Online English Teacher / Online English Tutor / Online English Tutoring- Online English Teacher Assistant / Online English Elementary Teacher- Summer Teacher / Casual Teacher / Assistant Teacher / Teaching Assistant- Elementary School Teacher / High School Teacher- Substitute Teacher / Teacher Assistant / Lead Teacher
The Basics of the Online English Teacher Role:- The classes: 25-minute full immersion English language, 1-on-1 classes- The pay: Depends on your experience, but as reported on Indeed, averages around $19/hour (for two 25 min. classes)- The curriculum: U.S. Common Core aligned lesson material, designed by our in-house curriculum team- Time of day: You choose your schedule from available class slots; peak student demand hours are listed below- Location: Conveniently teach remote from your own home - no commute!- What you need: You only need is computer, a strong internet connection, and a headset- Benefits: Learn best online teaching experiences from our professional team at no cost- The culture: You will learn about Chinese culture, families, and lifestyle through classroom exchanges with our students
Contract type: Independent contractorStart date: Immediately
Reserve your tickets today through Eventbrite and you will receive an email from us within 24-48 hours to complete your application.
Don't have a Bachelor's Degree, but know someone who does? Make $25 for each successful referral! Email us at: info@VIPKidGetHiredNow.com (Send us their email address once they sign-up. They must complete the interview process and become an employee to be eligible for the $25 referral bonus)

jobfair_list.description:
Are you still looking for that golden career opportunity that will allow you to build a solid future for yourself and your family? United Career Fairs can help! We have over 20 years of experience in connecting candidates just like you with hiring managers at companies ranging from small local businesses clear on up to Fortune 500 corporations. Register now to attend our upcoming career fair!  
Monday, December 17th, 2018 – 6pm SharpEmbassy Suites1939 N. Meacham Rd.Schaumburg, IL 60173
 
 Our career fairs focus specifically on Sales, Business Development, Marketing, Customer Service, and Retail & Sales Management jobs, and offer you individual, face-to-face time with hiring managers from a variety of different companies. All of our events are held in the evening, making it easier to work around your existing job schedule.  Here’s how it works: we will welcome you with a formal executive presentation in which each company will introduce itself and the opportunities they offer. You will then be free to meet with hiring managers from each company that has attracted your interest. At the same time, you will be able to network not only with various employers, but also with other professionals.   Whether you are a seasoned executive-level professional, just beginning your career, or anywhere in between, our events can connect you with as many valuable employer contacts in two hours as you would make in weeks of job searching on your own. Hiring managers will be onsite and ready to offer second interviews to qualified candidates.   Click here to pre-register today and reserve your spot at this exclusive hiring event!  

We encourage professionals of all levels of experience to attend our Career Fair. From entry-level and mid-level (3-10 years of experience) all the way up to C-level, hiring managers are looking for candidates just like you.   In order to make the most of your time at our event and to secure invitations for second interviews from the companies of your choice, you should be prepared to make a positive impression. We recommend that you:  

Arrive at the career fair no later than 6pm
Wear business professional attire
Bring at least 10-15 copies of your updated resume
Display an engaging and motivated attitude

 PLEASE NOTE: You must actually attend the event in order to meet directly with hiring managers and to be considered for their positions.   Typical positions for which employers may interview include: B2B, outside sales representatives, inside sales representatives, b2b sales, account managers, account executives, advertising, marketing, customer service, financial services, telemarketer, management trainee, financial advisor, sales managers, sales directors, telesales, territory sales representatives, insurance sales, pharmaceutical sales, route sales, retail sales representatives, retail sales managers, financial sales and many more!   
United Career Fairs – Uniting Great Companies with Great Candidates!

jobfair_list.name: 3rd Annual Lake County Engineering Internship & Job Fair
jobfair_list.description:
Friday, January 4, 201912 PM - 3:30 PMCollege of Lake County, Grayslake, IL
Build Your Talent Pipeline - Without Even Leaving the State!
Your company is invited to join us for the Lake County Engineering Internship & Job Fair, which is back for a third consecutive year, bigger and better than ever!
Last year, top businesses like yours had access to over 150 talented students from across the country, who traveled to Lake County to pursue jobs in the engineering field. Students came from prominent universities including Purdue, Marquette, Villanova, the University of Colorado, Bradley, the Milwaukee School of Engineering, and the University of Illinois.
You don't need to leave Lake County to have easy access to a talent pipeline - let us target the students and bring them to you to discuss career opportunities with your company. Students with training in biomedical, chemical, mechanical, industrial engineering, and more!
If you are looking to fill 2019 summer internships, or more permanent positions, you can't miss this opportunity. Register now to take advantage of the early-bird rate! 
Early-Bird Registration by December 21 – $500General Registration after December 21 – $550

jobfair_list.name: Chicago Lessons from Abroad Conference February 2019
jobfair_list.description:
Congratulations on your recent voyage abroad! We know you are excited about your experiences abroad and brimming with stories and insights into your host country’s culture. Might you be looking for a captive audience with whom to share those experiences, or are you seeking new ways to study, travel, orwork abroad again? If so, we invite you to attend the Chicago Lessons From Abroad Returnee Conference on Februray 2, 2019, hosted at DePaul University. 
Conference Highlights   • Meeting other recent study abroad returnees from Chicago and beyond • Hearing from dynamic and motivating keynote speakers • Learning how to talk about your newly acquired global skills in a job interview • Discovering how you can work or study abroad after graduation • Networking with professionals working in internationally-focused jobs • Staying connected to and sharing stories about your study abroad experience 
 
2018 Agenda (2019 schedule will be posted here once finalized)

9:30-10:00: Registration 
 
10:00-10:30: Welcome and Opening Keynote, Russ Alexander, The Education Abroad Network (TEAN)
 
10:30-11:45: Wanderlust Panel
 


Teach Abroad: International TEFL Acaemdy and Japan Exchange and Teaching (JET) Program 
Study Abroad (Again!): Concordia University-Irvine 
Advocate Abroad: Chicago Council on Global Affairs 
Intern Abroad: IES Internships  


12:00-1:00 Informational Roundtables with Wanderlust Panelists 
 
12:30-2:00: Concurrent Sessions I
 
Networking Lunch 
Opportunties Fair 
Resume Review 
 
2:00-3:00: Concurrent Sessions II
 
Personal Branding 
How to Apply ICC Skills 
Adapting Back: Navigating Reverse Culture Shock
 
3:15-4:15: Concurrent Sessions III
 
Fire Away: Q+A Panel on Study Abroad, ReEntry and Next Steps! 
Personal Branding 
How to Leverage Study Abroad Skills for Employment 
 
4:15-5:00: Closing remarks, including Photo Contest Winner and Go Abroad Again Scholarship Announcement 
 
Sponsorship Information
If you are interested in sponsorship opportunities, please contact Hannah hannah.demilta@teanabroad.org for more details.

Chicago Job Fair
Are you ready to interview with hundreds of employers? Best Hire Career Fairs is hosting another job fair in Chicago. Get dressed up and sharpen up your resume. jobfair_list.name: Chicago Veterans Job Fair
jobfair_list.location:
Soldier Field
1410 Museum Campus Drive
Chicago, IL 60605
jobfair_list.description:
Our events average over 50 exhibitors, and the list is not final until the day of the event. Check back regularly for additions.

Exhibitors
Air Wisconsin Airlines Corporation
Airstreams Renewables, Inc.
Allstate
Argosy University
Baird & Warner
Chicago Transit Authority
CSL Behring
Edward Hines Jr, VA Hospital, Department of Veterans Affair
Kay & Associates, Inc.
National Corporate Housing
PepsiCo
Rivers Casino
TCF Bank
Tower Loan
Wayne County Sheriff's Office
Soldier Field

Soldier Field Information
The Job Fair will take place in the 1st Floor United Club.

Enter the stadium through Gate 38 at the North end of the stadium and you will be directed to the event space.

Parking Information
Upon arrival, please follow the signs directing cars to the United Club levels of the North Garage. Enter the stadium through the United Club entrance. Attendants will be on-site to assist with directions.

Public transportation is also available. Take the train to Roosevelt and State station then take the #146 bus toward Museum Campus (Soldier Field)

ARRIVING FROM THE LOOP
North Parking Garage: Travel southbound on Lake Shore Drive (or southbound on Columbus Drive), and move toward the right lanes as you approach Soldier Field. Proceed to the 18th Street exit, which is the first exit on the right after you pass Soldier Field. Note: Please note that you can only exit 18th Street from the far right lane of southbound Lake Shore Drive. If you miss the 18th Street exit, you will have to go all the way to 31st Street to turn around. When you exit at 18th Street, turn left at the bottom of the exit and go under the viaduct. Continue on 18th Street which becomes Museum Campus Drive. Continue North on Museum Campus Drive (on the east/lake side of Soldier Field) through the Waldron Drive intersection and past the ADA & Taxi drop-off turn-around. Keep on Museum Campus Drive past the Soldier Field loading dock entrance. Take the first left after the loading dock into the North Parking Garage.

ARRIVING FROM THE NORTHERN SUBURBS
North Parking Garage: Take the Edens Expressway (I-94) eastbound until it merges into the Kennedy Expressway (I-90/94). Continue on the Kennedy past the Loop to the Taylor Street/Roosevelt Road exit. Take this exit to Roosevelt Road, which is the second stoplight off the exit, and turn left onto Roosevelt Road. Follow Roosevelt Road to Columbus Drive; take a right onto Columbus Drive. Follow Columbus Drive until it merges into southbound Lake Shore Drive. Stay in the right hand lane and proceed to the 18th Street exit, which is the first exit on the right after you pass Soldier Field. Note: Please note that you can only exit 18th Street from the far right lane of southbound Lake Shore Drive. If you miss the 18th Street exit, you will have to go all the way to 31st Street to turn around. When you exit at 18th Street, turn left at the bottom of the exit and go under the viaduct. Continue on 18th Street which becomes Museum Campus Drive. Continue North on Museum Campus Drive (on the east/lake side of Soldier Field) through the Waldron Drive intersection and past the ADA & Taxi drop-off turn-around. Keep on Museum Campus Drive past the Soldier Field loading dock entrance. Take the first left after the loading dock into the North Parking Garage.

ARRIVING FROM THE WEST
North Parking Garage: Take the Eisenhower Expressway (I-290) eastbound until it becomes Congress Parkway. Continue on Congress Parkway until it dead ends at Columbus Drive (Buckingham Fountain will be directly in front of you). Turn right onto Columbus Drive. Follow Columbus Drive until it merges into southbound Lake Shore Drive. Stay in the right hand lane and proceed to the 18th Street exit, which is the first exit on the right after you pass Soldier Field. Note: Please note that you can only exit 18th Street from the far right lane of southbound Lake Shore Drive. If you miss the 18th Street exit, you will have to go all the way to 31st Street to turn around. When you exit at 18th Street, turn left at the bottom of the exit and go under the viaduct. Continue on 18th Street which becomes Museum Campus Drive. Continue North on Museum Campus Drive (on the east/lake side of Soldier Field) through the Waldron Drive intersection and past the ADA & Taxi drop-off turn-around. Keep on Museum Campus Drive past the Soldier Field loading dock entrance. Take the first left after the loading dock into the North Parking Garage.

ARRIVING FROM THE SOUTH
North Parking Garage: Travel northbound on Lake Shore Drive, and move toward the right lanes as you approach Soldier Field. Proceed to the 18th Street exit. When you exit at 18th Street, turn right at the bottom of the exit. Continue on 18th Street which becomes Museum Campus Drive. Continue North on Museum Campus Drive (on the east/lake side of Soldier Field) through the Waldron Drive intersection and past the ADA & Taxi drop-off turn-around. Keep on Museum Campus Drive past the Soldier Field loading dock entrance. Take the first left after the loading dock into the North Parking Garage. Note: Please note that if you miss the 18th Street exit, you can turn right at Waldron Drive. As you head east on Waldron Drive take a left at Museum Campus Drive and continue to the North Garage.

The Job Fair will take place in the AT&T Endzone West.

Please enter the stadium through Entry "J."

Parking Information
Complimentary parking is available in Parking Lot 10.

Attendees should enter the stadium through Entry J.

DIRECTIONS:
From Dallas (east of AT&T Stadium)
Interstate 30 West Exit Ballpark Way. Keep right at the end of the exit ramp. Turn Right on Ballpark Way. Turn Right on Randol Mill Road. Lot 10 will be on the left just past Lots 1-3 before Collins Street.

From Fort Worth (west of AT&T Stadium)
Interstate 30 East Exit Collins Street (FM157). Turn right on Collins Street (FM157) at the end of the exit ramp. Turn Left on Randol Mill Road. Turn Right into Lot 10.

From DFW Airport & Grapevine Area (north of AT&T Stadium)
Highway 360 South Exit Division Street. Keep right at the end of the exit ramp on to Division Street heading west. Turn Right on AT&T Way. Turn Left on Randol Mill Road. Lot 10 will be on the left just past Lots 1-3 before Collins Street.

jobfair_list.name: DWE Career Fair
jobfair_list.description:
Are you still wasting time, money, and energy looking for jobs —without anything to show for it?
Stop being another name and another statistic in a random company’s database. It’s time for you to step up your job hunting game!
The DWE Career Fair is designed to help you land great jobs and step up your job hunting game for FREE by:

Giving you a chance to show off your PERSONALITY to the best hiring companies in Dallas. (One of the many things you can’t express through online job hunting!)


Helping you impress company representatives IN-PERSON with your knowledge & experience (That you just CAN’T put on your resume!)


Providing you with a chance to get hired ON THE SPOT. (No more waiting!)

All of these for FREE!
Whether you’re looking for a REGULAR job or a SEASONAL job, DWE Career Fair companies have the perfect position just for you! It won’t cost you anything!
Get hired at the DWE Career Fair and enjoy these:

Competitive Salary Package
Performance Incentives (Bonus/Commission)
Health & Life Insurance
Paid Leaves/Holidays
Rapid Career Growth
Paid Company Training

And more!
Here are a few tips to increase your chances of getting hired by 10x:

Be in your best corporate attire
Bring tons of resume
Keep your resume concise & professional (No fancy designs and fonts)
Confidently engage the company representatives
Flash your biggest smile!

Good luck!
See you at the job fair!
Petya Edwards
P.S. Text DWE to 33222 for exclusive updates!

Hansen & Adkins Auto Transport Hiring Event! Offers on the Spot! Snacks and Refreshments provided!
We will be holding interviews for the following positions:


CDL-A Company Auto Hauler Truck Driver
-
$78,000 / year, Full-time


CDL-A Owner Operator Auto Hauler Truck Driver
-
$312,000 / year, Full-time



We will be hiring for the following location:

Hansen & Adkins Houston Terminal, 1814 Westfield Loop, Houston, TX 77073


Requirements

Must Have A Class-A CDL
Must Be 23 Years Of Age Or Older
Must Have 2 Years Of Tractor Trailer Driving Experience
Must Have A Good Driving Record

How to prepare
The entire interview process will last about 1 hr. Please bring 2 forms of ID with you to the event.
What to wear
Dress code is Casual Business (jeans, button down, no tennis shoes).
About the Company

Join us at our Houston Terminal this Saturday, November 17th to discover why a career with Hansen & Adkins is the right fit for you!
At Hansen & Adkins, we are committed to offering you the advantages you need and the perks you deserve. This is how we became a top-choice carrier for professional auto hauler truck drivers and their families. You’ll enjoy a generous benefits package and fantastic pay. Plus, we offer scheduled raises for length of service, and bonuses for safe auto hauling and damage-free work.
 
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

We at GardaWorld admire the dedication, discipline, and leadership of veterans and military men and women. As a global leader in security services, GardaWorld values the expertise and ambition of veterans, and we are eager to facilitate the transition to civilian life for those who served.
We encourage veterans to join our team and explore careers in Armoured Truck Transport, Cash Vault Services, High Profile Security Services jobs, and more.

jobfair_list.description:
RecruitMilitary, a national military recruiting firm established in 1998, and DAV, a major veteran service organization established in 1920 and serving veterans of all eras, have partnered and are delivering a career fair for military veterans in the Houston area. 
Anyone who has served on active duty, in the National Guard, or in the Reserves and their spouses is invited to attend this event to find a new career.
Local, regional and national companies will attend to recruit for open positions. Companies include: DAV, CenterPoint Energy, First Command Financial, Garda World, JSW Steel, Mustang CAT, TBC Corporation and many more. 
For a full company list and all details of the event, please visit, http://recruitmilitary.com/Houston. 
There is no cost for veterans or their spouses to attend.
For access to over 240,000 jobs for military veterans, visit http://RecruitMilitary.com. 
Employers interested in attending the event to recruit talented military veterans are invited to call 1-800-226-0841.

jobfair_list.name: Houston Job Fair DECEMBER 10TH! *Sales, Management, Business Development, Marketing
jobfair_list.location:
Sheraton Houston Brookhollow
3000 North Loop West
Houston, TX 77092
jobfair_list.description:
Are you still looking for that golden career opportunity that will allow you to build a solid future for yourself and your family? United Career Fairs can help! We have over 20 years of experience in connecting candidates just like you with hiring managers at companies ranging from small local businesses clear on up to Fortune 500 corporations. Register now to attend our upcoming career fair!  
Monday, December 10th, 2018 – 6pm SharpSheraton Houston Brookhollow 3000 North Loop WestHouston, TX 77092
 
 Our career fairs focus specifically on Sales, Business Development, Marketing, Customer Service, and Retail & Sales Management jobs, and offer you individual, face-to-face time with hiring managers from a variety of different companies. All of our events are held in the evening, making it easier to work around your existing job schedule.  Here’s how it works: we will welcome you with a formal executive presentation in which each company will introduce itself and the opportunities they offer. You will then be free to meet with hiring managers from each company that has attracted your interest. At the same time, you will be able to network not only with various employers, but also with other professionals.   Whether you are a seasoned executive-level professional, just beginning your career, or anywhere in between, our events can connect you with as many valuable employer contacts in two hours as you would make in weeks of job searching on your own. Hiring managers will be onsite and ready to offer second interviews to qualified candidates.   Click here to pre-register today and reserve your spot at this exclusive hiring event!  

We encourage professionals of all levels of experience to attend our Career Fair. From entry-level and mid-level (3-10 years of experience) all the way up to C-level, hiring managers are looking for candidates just like you.   In order to make the most of your time at our event and to secure invitations for second interviews from the companies of your choice, you should be prepared to make a positive impression. We recommend that you:  

Arrive at the career fair no later than 6pm
Wear business professional attire
Bring at least 10-15 copies of your updated resume
Display an engaging and motivated attitude

 PLEASE NOTE: You must actually attend the event in order to meet directly with hiring managers and to be considered for their positions.   Typical positions for which employers may interview include: B2B, outside sales representatives, inside sales representatives, b2b sales, account managers, account executives, advertising, marketing, customer service, financial services, telemarketer, management trainee, financial advisor, sales managers, sales directors, telesales, territory sales representatives, insurance sales, pharmaceutical sales, route sales, retail sales representatives, retail sales managers, financial sales and many more!   
United Career Fairs – Uniting Great Companies with Great Candidates!

    1814 Westfield Loop




Houston, TX 77073
jobfair_list.description:
Hansen & Adkins Auto Transport Hiring Event! Offers on the Spot! Snacks and Refreshments provided!
We will be holding interviews for the following positions:


CDL-A Company Auto Hauler Truck Driver
-
$78,000 / year, Full-time


CDL-A Owner Operator Auto Hauler Truck Driver
-
$312,000 / year, Full-time



We will be hiring for the following location:

Hansen & Adkins Houston Terminal, 1814 Westfield Loop, Houston, TX 77073


Requirements

Must Have A Class-A CDL
Must Be 23 Years Of Age Or Older
Must Have 2 Years Of Tractor Trailer Driving Experience
Must Have A Good Driving Record

How to prepare
The entire interview process will last about 1 hr. Please bring 2 forms of ID with you to the event.
What to wear
Dress code is Casual Business (jeans, button down, no tennis shoes).
About the Company

Join us at our Houston Terminal this Saturday, November 17th to discover why a career with Hansen & Adkins is the right fit for you!
At Hansen & Adkins, we are committed to offering you the advantages you need and the perks you deserve. This is how we became a top-choice carrier for professional auto hauler truck drivers and their families. You’ll enjoy a generous benefits package and fantastic pay. Plus, we offer scheduled raises for length of service, and bonuses for safe auto hauling and damage-free work.
 
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

    This is an ad, and the event is hosted by a third-party. Indeed makes no guarantees about the accuracy of the ad's details.

jobfair_list.name: CIBT Visas, Inc. - Hiring Event
jobfair_list.location:
CIBT Visas
    5757 Wilshire Blvd.




Los Angeles, CA 90036
jobfair_list.description:
CIBT Visas, Inc. Hiring Event!
We will be holding interviews for the following positions:


Courier/Liaison
-
$17 - $19 / hour, Full-time


Visa and Passport Specialist
-
$16 - $17 / hour, Full-time


Global Visa Consultant
-
$17 - $18 / hour, Full-time



We will be hiring for the following location:

CIBT Visas, 5757 Wilshire Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90036


Requirements

Customer Service
Microsoft Office - Power Point, Excel, Outlook, Adobe, Word
Paralegal
Global Immigration
Organization
Time Management
Teamwork
Communication

How to prepare
The entire interview process will last about 15 min. Completing our online application prior to the event is strongly encouraged and will speed up the process. Please bring your resume and cIBT Job Application with you to the event.
What to wear
Dress code is Business Casual (slacks, button down, optional tie).
About the Company
We are looking for new talent to join our growing team as we continue to push the boundaries with our innovative global mobility solutions. We need committed problem solvers who have the dedication to take us to the next level and grow our brand on a global scale. We are on the lookout for self-starters who are comfortable taking initiative and relish in owning the customer experience from start to finish.
We are committed to employing great people from all walks of life and recognize the value of diversity in creating a unique and rewarding culture that not only reflects our global footprint but the clients we serve. We are looking for people who want to launch their career with CIBT and be a part of our growth and success. We offer competitive individual health coverage and additional earning potential through our quarterly incentive plan.
If you’re the kind of person who thrives in a challenging environment, enjoys every day being different, and want to help take us to the next level, then CIBT could be the place for you.
 
 
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

    This is an ad, and the event is hosted by a third-party. Indeed makes no guarantees about the accuracy of the ad's details.

Job seekers looking for a new career opportunity and attend our interview-style career fairs are much more likely to quickly find a new position than those who apply at company career pages or online job board posting. You will need to complete registration on Eventbrite's site and once completed, you will receive a VIP pass and be redirected back to Choice Career Fairs. Eventbrite is an event listing and management application and the data you provide will be used only in accordance with the event you are registering for. Registration is not required to attend our FREE career fair.
Career Fair Details
What to expect...
You'll meet face-to-face with hiring decision-makers from some of the areas top employers. Dress professionally and bring plenty of resumes, because they're here to hire.

Walk in and start interviewing, it's that simple. Save time, money and effort interviewing with multiple companies in one day at one location. Many of these companies have several openings and are eager to meet with you. You're no longer just a piece of paper. Attend the career fair and get infront of decision makers.

What are you waiting for?... Let us know you're coming and register today

jobfair_list.name: Irvine Career Fair
jobfair_list.description:
Are you looking for a job? Are you tired of sending resumes left and right and never getting an answer? If you are, dress in your best professional clothes, bring resumes and visit our Irvine Career Fairs. You will have the opportunity to meet top-employers and to interview for several positions during the course of the day, meeting the people who actually make the hiring decisions. You will save a lot of time since there will be no need to craft a customized personal statement for each company you visit: You’ll be able to tell them why you wish to work for them, and you’ll have the chance to sell yourself.

Our employers send their managers to carry out onsite interviews. Don’t wait for someone to call you for an interview. Sign up for our next career fair and give off a first impression that makes a lasting career.

jobfair_list.name: CIBT Visas, Inc. - Hiring Event
jobfair_list.location:
CIBT Visas
    5757 Wilshire Blvd.




Los Angeles, CA 90036
jobfair_list.description:
CIBT Visas, Inc. Hiring Event!
We will be holding interviews for the following positions:


Courier/Liaison
-
$17 - $19 / hour, Full-time


Visa and Passport Specialist
-
$16 - $17 / hour, Full-time


Global Visa Consultant
-
$17 - $18 / hour, Full-time



We will be hiring for the following location:

CIBT Visas, 5757 Wilshire Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90036


Requirements

Customer Service
Microsoft Office - Power Point, Excel, Outlook, Adobe, Word
Paralegal
Global Immigration
Organization
Time Management
Teamwork
Communication

How to prepare
The entire interview process will last about 15 min. Completing our online application prior to the event is strongly encouraged and will speed up the process. Please bring your resume and cIBT Job Application with you to the event.
What to wear
Dress code is Business Casual (slacks, button down, optional tie).
About the Company
We are looking for new talent to join our growing team as we continue to push the boundaries with our innovative global mobility solutions. We need committed problem solvers who have the dedication to take us to the next level and grow our brand on a global scale. We are on the lookout for self-starters who are comfortable taking initiative and relish in owning the customer experience from start to finish.
We are committed to employing great people from all walks of life and recognize the value of diversity in creating a unique and rewarding culture that not only reflects our global footprint but the clients we serve. We are looking for people who want to launch their career with CIBT and be a part of our growth and success. We offer competitive individual health coverage and additional earning potential through our quarterly incentive plan.
If you’re the kind of person who thrives in a challenging environment, enjoys every day being different, and want to help take us to the next level, then CIBT could be the place for you.
 
 
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

    This is an ad, and the event is hosted by a third-party. Indeed makes no guarantees about the accuracy of the ad's details.

Facility Access Information
Acceptable Access Documentation
All visitors must possess the following item(s) or you will not be allowed access to the military installation or the Job Fair:

You must present the following: Military Identification Card (Active, Reserve/Guard, Retiree ID); or Civilian/Contractor CAC Card) OR Non-military photo ID.
Current and compliant driver’s license. See the following link for states with compliant licenses: REAL ID STATES. If your state license is not compliant, a valid passport is acceptable.
Current automobile registration or rental car contract.
Current proof of automobile insurance or rental car contract.
If your driver’s license, passport or other identification has expired or is no longer valid you "WILL NOT" be allowed to enter the post.
As part of security measures on a military post your vehicle may be subject to inspection. This is part of the security measures against any terrorist threats. Please cooperate with security and their mission.

The Job Fair will take place in the Del Mar Room.

Long Beach Convention and Entertainment Center Information
The Job Fair will take place in the Promenade Ballroom located on the Promenade level of the center.
Parking Information
IF DRIVING, The Promenade Parking Garage located next to the Hyatt is the most convenient location to the event space and has 350 spaces available. There is an elevator which leads from the parking garage to the main door of the convention center.

Overflow parking will be available across from the Performance Center. A sky bridge leads from the garage to the front entrance of the convention center.

An additional 3,000 parking spaces are available in surrounding garages and surface lots.

Rates vary per lot.

IF TAKING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION, the Passport is a FREE bus that connects travelers to downtown Long Beach including the Convention Center. For more information, please visit their website: http://www.lbtransit.com/Services/Passport.aspx

Inland Empire Job Fair
Are you ready to interview with hundreds of employers? Best Hire Career Fairs is hosting another job fair in Inland Empire. Get dressed up and sharpen up your resume. If you are looking for a job in Inland Empire this event is one you will not want to miss. Interview with multiple candidates from the cities top employers. Print out multiple resumes, dress your best and land your dream job.

Anaheim Job Fair
Are you ready to interview with hundreds of employers? Best Hire Career Fairs is hosting another job fair in Anaheim. Get dressed up and sharpen up your resume. Once you arrive, you will check in to the event letting employers know that you are here. Then You will visit all the employers and see what they are offering; this allows you to try and see yourself in that role and ask plenty of questions. If you are a match for the job and look the part, you could get hired on the spot.

If you are looking for a job in Anaheim California this event is one you will not want to miss. Interview with multiple candidates from the cities top employers. Print out multiple resumes, dress your best and land your dream job.

The Multi-Profession Diversity Job Fair of New YorkFriday, November 16, 201810:00 AM - 1:00 PMStewart Hotel371 7th AvenueNew York, NY 10001

Tips for Success:


Pre-register—Receive notifications of any updates or changes to the event, and receive information about upcoming events in your area.


Dress professionally—First impressions go a long way.


Bring multiple copies of your resume.


Arrive any time between 10AM and 1PM—Plan to spend 45 minutes to 1 hour at the event.


Bring a friend—All job seekers are welcome.


Prepare a brief but effective “brag” to let the people you meet with get to know you.


Keep an open mind—Meet with as many of the companies as you can; you may be pleasantly surprised at what you find.


Remember, the best way to be considered for a position is to meet the hiring managers in person. Plan to attend this event!
Questions?

Metropolitan Pavilion

Metropolitan Pavilion Information
The Job Fair will be held in full Pavilion located on the first floor of the Metropolitan Pavilion.

Parking Information
BY SUBWAY
Parking in New York can be extremely expensive. We encourage the use of public transportation.

The following subway lines have stops near to Metropolitan Pavilion. Visit New York City Transit / MTA for service status, transport-related apps, and more, as well as standard subway and bus route maps.

The No. 1 train; from the 18th St. stop, walk east to 125 W. 18th St.,

The No. 2 or 3 train; from the 14th St. stop, walk uptown (north) to 18th St. and 7th Avenue; turn right onto 18th St., and proceed east to 125 W. 18th St.

The A, C, or E train; from the 14th St. stop, walk uptown (north) on 8th Avenue to 18th St.; turn right onto 18th St., then, crossing over 7th Avenue, proceed to 125 W. 18th St.

The M, F or L train; from the 14th St. stop, walk uptown (north) on 6th Avenue to 18th St., then turn left onto 18th St. and proceed to 125 W. 18th St.

The No. 4, 5, 6, Q, R, N, or W train; from the 14th St. stop at Union Square, walk uptown to 18th St. and then proceed west to 125 W. 18th St.

PARKING
Parking Panda and SpotHero are examples of parking availability and reservation apps that may assist you. If you have parking-related inquiries, please contact the lot/garage directly. The information below comes from public lot/garage listings and are the closest garages to the Metropolitan Pavilion. RecruitMilitary is not responsible for such listings’ accuracy.

MP W 20 LLC 180 West 20th Street New York, NY 10011 Between 6th & 7th Ave. (212) 488-5900

Rapid Park 124 West 20th Street Between 6th & 7th Ave. (212) 627-7739 Hours: 24 Hours/7 Days a Week

587 6th Ave. 587 6th Avenue New York, NY 10001 SW crnr of 6th Ave. & 17th St. (800) 836-6666

Little Man Parking 150 West 20th Street New York, NY 10011 Between 6th & 7th Ave. (212) 627-4505

jobfair_list.location:
Metropolitan Pavilion
125 West 18th Street
New York, NY 10011
jobfair_list.description:
Our events average over 50 exhibitors, and the list is not final until the day of the event. Check back regularly for additions.

Featured Exhibitors
Canon USA, Inc.
Exhibitors
Allstate
Children's Village
Department Veteran Affairs
Montefiore Medical Center
New York City Fire Department
New York University
NYC Department of Corrections
Metropolitan Pavilion

Metropolitan Pavilion Information
The Job Fair will be held in full Pavilion located on the first floor of the Metropolitan Pavilion.

Parking Information
BY SUBWAY
Parking in New York can be extremely expensive. We encourage the use of public transportation.

The following subway lines have stops near to Metropolitan Pavilion. Visit New York City Transit / MTA for service status, transport-related apps, and more, as well as standard subway and bus route maps.

The No. 1 train; from the 18th St. stop, walk east to 125 W. 18th St.,

The No. 2 or 3 train; from the 14th St. stop, walk uptown (north) to 18th St. and 7th Avenue; turn right onto 18th St., and proceed east to 125 W. 18th St.

The A, C, or E train; from the 14th St. stop, walk uptown (north) on 8th Avenue to 18th St.; turn right onto 18th St., then, crossing over 7th Avenue, proceed to 125 W. 18th St.

The M, F or L train; from the 14th St. stop, walk uptown (north) on 6th Avenue to 18th St., then turn left onto 18th St. and proceed to 125 W. 18th St.

The No. 4, 5, 6, Q, R, N, or W train; from the 14th St. stop at Union Square, walk uptown to 18th St. and then proceed west to 125 W. 18th St.

PARKING
Parking Panda and SpotHero are examples of parking availability and reservation apps that may assist you. If you have parking-related inquiries, please contact the lot/garage directly. The information below comes from public lot/garage listings and are the closest garages to the Metropolitan Pavilion. RecruitMilitary is not responsible for such listings’ accuracy.

MP W 20 LLC 180 West 20th Street New York, NY 10011 Between 6th & 7th Ave. (212) 488-5900

Rapid Park 124 West 20th Street Between 6th & 7th Ave. (212) 627-7739 Hours: 24 Hours/7 Days a Week

587 6th Ave. 587 6th Avenue New York, NY 10001 SW crnr of 6th Ave. & 17th St. (800) 836-6666

Little Man Parking 150 West 20th Street New York, NY 10011 Between 6th & 7th Ave. (212) 627-4505

jobfair_list.description:
Our events average over 50 exhibitors, and the list is not final until the day of the event. Check back regularly for additions.

Exhibitors
Allstate
Children's Village
Department Veteran Affairs
Montefiore Medical Center
New York City Fire Department
Pentagon Force Protection Agency
Metropolitan Pavilion

Metropolitan Pavilion Information
The Job Fair will be held in full Pavilion located on the first floor of the Metropolitan Pavilion.

Parking Information
BY SUBWAY
Parking in New York can be extremely expensive. We encourage the use of public transportation.

The following subway lines have stops near to Metropolitan Pavilion. Visit New York City Transit / MTA for service status, transport-related apps, and more, as well as standard subway and bus route maps.

The No. 1 train; from the 18th St. stop, walk east to 125 W. 18th St.,

The No. 2 or 3 train; from the 14th St. stop, walk uptown (north) to 18th St. and 7th Avenue; turn right onto 18th St., and proceed east to 125 W. 18th St.

The A, C, or E train; from the 14th St. stop, walk uptown (north) on 8th Avenue to 18th St.; turn right onto 18th St., then, crossing over 7th Avenue, proceed to 125 W. 18th St.

The M, F or L train; from the 14th St. stop, walk uptown (north) on 6th Avenue to 18th St., then turn left onto 18th St. and proceed to 125 W. 18th St.

The No. 4, 5, 6, Q, R, N, or W train; from the 14th St. stop at Union Square, walk uptown to 18th St. and then proceed west to 125 W. 18th St.

PARKING
Parking Panda and SpotHero are examples of parking availability and reservation apps that may assist you. If you have parking-related inquiries, please contact the lot/garage directly. The information below comes from public lot/garage listings and are the closest garages to the Metropolitan Pavilion. RecruitMilitary is not responsible for such listings’ accuracy.

MP W 20 LLC 180 West 20th Street New York, NY 10011 Between 6th & 7th Ave. (212) 488-5900

Rapid Park 124 West 20th Street Between 6th & 7th Ave. (212) 627-7739 Hours: 24 Hours/7 Days a Week

587 6th Ave. 587 6th Avenue New York, NY 10001 SW crnr of 6th Ave. & 17th St. (800) 836-6666

Little Man Parking 150 West 20th Street New York, NY 10011 Between 6th & 7th Ave. (212) 627-4505

About the Company

We're a company that cares about the lives of our co-workers. At IKEA, our benefits are designed for the many. That means that all of our co-workers, both full-time and part-time, hourly and salaried, and their dependents are eligible for at least a portion of our comprehensive benefits package. We consider co-workers working at least 20 hours to be full-time, a threshold notably lower than the industry average among retailers.
Perks include:
-Medical (20 hours and up)
-Dental
-Vision
-401(k)
-Pension Program "TACK!"
-Paid Time Off
-Hourly wage starting at $15.20, minimum
-Plus much more!
We're a diverse group of down-to-earth, straightforward people with a passion for home furnishing. We come from all over the world but we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”. How we realize this vision is based on our shared humanistic values. These values are the foundation of our work and our inclusive, empathizing, open and honest culture.

Working with us is like working with your friends. Our culture is based on the spirit of togetherness, enthusiasm and fun. And we're always looking for people who share our positive attitude and values.

Levi's Stadium Information
The Job Fair will take place in the BNY Mellon East & Brocade Club located on the main level of the stadium on the EAST side. Enter the stadium through Gate E.
Please allow time to enter through metal detectors.
Parking Information
There is FREE parking available to Job Fair attendees. The Yellow Lot is closest to the Brocade Club. Enter the stadium through Gate E.

Directions: Turn onto Tasman Drive from Great America Parkway. Pass the stadium and turn LEFT at the traffic light onto Centennial Blvd. Turn LEFT onto Stars and Stripes Drive and continue toward the parking lot. After parking, cross Tasman at Marie P DeBartolo Way and continue walking past Gate F. Enter the stadium through the glass doors on the right, just before the Levi's 501 Club sign.

Amazon Hiring Event! Offers on the Spot!
We are looking to hire for the following positions:


Warehouse Team Member
-
$15.00 / hour, Part-time



We will be hiring for the following locations:

BFI4 - 21005 64th Avenue S - Kent, WA 98032, kent,  98032
BFI5- 20526 59th Pl S, Kent, WA 98032, Kent,  98032


Requirements

You must be 18 years or older and have a high school diploma or equivalent

How to prepare
Please plan on spending 2 hr at the event. Please bring your necessary documents with you to the event: If you are hired and accept the position, you will need to provide proof of your identity and employment eligibility as required by federal law by completing a Form I-9. Here is a link to the List of Acceptable Document(s) that are needed (either 1 from List A or 1 from List B and 1 from List C): https://www.uscis.gov/i-9-central/acceptable-documents
What to wear
Dress code is Casual (come as you are, but please be presentable).
About the Company

WE RAISED THE BAR ON WAGES
All U.S. employees earn at least $15/hour.

Whether you're looking for part-time, flex or seasonal, we are putting more money in your pocket. See how Amazon can transform your life.

Each Amazon team member is part of the magic of bringing orders to life. We all come together to help make the holidays happen.

Whether you want a career or to earn extra cash now, we offer part-time, seasonal and flexible schedules that work with your life. During the holidays you can flex-up and work additional hours to earn even more.
Want to win an echo dot?
Bring a friend to the hiring event for Part-Time Warehouse position for a chance of winning at our raffle.
 
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

Team Member

-
