We will be hiring for the following locations:

All locations in the surrounding area of the event location


Requirements

Must acquire State Food Handler’s Permit
Extraordinary communication and multitasking skills
High attention to detail

How to prepare
The entire interview process will last about 15 min. Completing our online application prior to the event is strongly encouraged and will speed up the process. Please bring your resume with you to the event.
What to wear

About the Company
At Beecher’s we’ve created something special: great food, a better place to work and a commitment to our communities. Beecher’s handmade cheese is authentic, original and full-flavored food handcrafted in traditional ways with the best ingredients.  We are part of Sugar Mountain, a creative food company that cares deeply about the health, well-being and culinary delight of our customers.  creative food company that cares deeply about the health, well-being and culinary delight of our customers.
PERKS OF THE JOB
Sugar Mountain has a lot to offer, from quality-focused, passionate, and fun colleagues to competitive pay, employee meal program and employee discounts at all our Sugar Mountain locations. 

We are committed to building a staff that includes individuals from different cultural backgrounds, genders, ages, sexual orientation and physical abilities. We strive to create a team that reflects the diversity of the communities we work in.

Sugar Mountain is a tobacco- free company.

jobfair_list.name: Veterans Job Fair - Greater Seattle, WA
jobfair_list.description:
GardaWorld is pleased to participate in the RecruitMilitary Opportunity Expo, an event where transitioning military, veterans, and their spouses can meet with recruiters from dozens of companies. The event is free for attendees.
We at GardaWorld admire the dedication, discipline, and leadership of veterans and military men and women. As a global leader in security services, GardaWorld values the expertise and ambition of veterans, and we are eager to facilitate the transition to civilian life for those who served.
We encourage veterans to join our team and explore careers in Armoured Truck Transport, Cash Vault Services, High Profile Security Services jobs, and more.

jobfair_list.description:
RecruitMilitary, a national military recruiting firm established in 1998, and DAV, a major veteran service organization established in 1920 and serving veterans of all eras, have partnered and are delivering a career fair for military veterans in the greater Seattle area. 
Anyone who has served on active duty, in the National Guard, or in the Reserves and their spouses is invited to attend this event to find a new career.
Local, regional and national companies will attend to recruit for open positions. Companies include: DAV, Lockheed Martin, Military Sealift Command, Seattle Police Department, GardaWorld, GoDaddy, Sound Mental Health and many more. 
For a full company list and all details of the event, please visit, http://recruitmilitary.com/Seattle. 
There is no cost for veterans or their spouses to attend.
For access to over 240,000 jobs for military veterans, visit http://RecruitMilitary.com. 
Employers interested in attending the event to recruit talented military veterans are invited to call 1-800-226-0841.

jobfair_list.name: Tech Career Fair and Demo Day @ Galvanize
jobfair_list.location:
Galvanize - Seattle
111 South Jackson Street
Seattle, WA 98104
jobfair_list.description:
Our goal is to create the most inclusive career fair to connect talent across the Seattle area.
Join us for an evening of networking and project demos with Seattle’s hottest tech talent.
Job Seekers: 
Looking to boost your job search? Come meet your next employer at Galvanize for the Startup and Tech Career Fair. We’re bringing some of the most innovative and high growth Seattle tech companies through our doors to speak with prospective employees.
Hiring Partners:
Our focus at Galvanize is on serving our students, so we don't charge recruiting fees. There is no fee to attend this event, nor does Galvanize charge a placement fee. We'd love to have you give back and help us build the community through guest lectures, hosting a project, or continuing to attend events like these! 
Not hiring currently? No worries. Come and enjoy the event anyway. It's always a great time.
General RSVP:
This event is open to the general public! Come visit Galvanize and check out some of the amazing things we are doing - ranging from our top-rated education programs, to our suite of enterprise offerings. We hope to see you there! 

About Galvanize 
Galvanize is the premiere dynamic learning community for technology. With campuses located in booming technology sectors throughout the country, Galvanize provides a community for each the following:
Education – part-time and full-time training in web development, data science, and data engineering  
Workspace – whether you’re a freelancer, startup, or established business, we provide beautiful spaces with a community dedicated to supporting your company’s growth  
Networking – events in the tech industry happen constantly in our campuses, ranging from popular Meetups to multi-day international conferences
To learn more about Galvanize, visit galvanize.com.

jobfair_list.name: Enumclaw's 7th Annual Interactive STEAM Expo
jobfair_list.description:
Construction is happening all around Enumclaw and the Pacific Northwest and we are proud to announce that is exactly what this year's iSTEAM Expo is all about!
New for 2019, our iSTEM logo was reconstructed to include an "A" that represents the skilled Arts careers in addition to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math. This year's iSTEAM Expo will focus on the variety of jobs, internships, apprenticeships, educational pathways and skills that are required to enter the construction industry and many other high tech trades and skilled careers. As always, all STEAM related fields are invited to exhibit.
All exhibitors are encouraged to share through hands on activities how STEAM related skills are used in the classroom or workplace. This interactive approach gives students the opportunity to explore a variety of skills related to STEAM fields and the learning pathways in obtaining those skills that lead to a future career.
We believe every student should have an opportunity to excel while exploring the science, technology, engineering, art and mathematics (STEAM) careers. Creatively engaging our youth in these fields through interactive exhibits at Enumclaw's iSTEAM Expo, science fairs, robotics competitions, job shadow opportunities, and career ready days are some of the ways we hope to encourage young people to solve problems of the future and create a better world for all.
We look forward to partnering with you at the 7th Annual Interactive STEAM Expo in Enumclaw on Thursday February 7, 2019.

Check out the video of our talented students in action building their 2018 Tiny Home Project in Enumclaw High School's Construction and Architectural Design class at:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O7l0AjunYfA

jobfair_list.name: iSchool Career Fair 2019
jobfair_list.location:
University of Washington
HUB Ballrooms
Seattle, WA 98195
jobfair_list.description:
The iSchool Career Fair is an opportunity for organizations to discuss job and internship opportunities with outstanding students from a variety of information-related disciplines. The fair is open to iSchool students and others across the University of Washington's three campuses. Last year, more than 800 students attended the fair.
This is an ideal venue for employers looking to hire for information technology and information science roles. Past participants have used the fair to fill positions including application developer, cybersecurity analyst, data analyst, information architect, IT consultant, project manager, research associate, software developer, taxonomist, and UX designer.
*Special note for libraries: While library employers are welcome to attend the iSchool Career Fair, we will be hosting a separate event, specifically for library & information science organizations, on January 27, 2019 (2-4PM), to coincide with the ALA mid-winter conference. The purpose of this event is to engage MLIS students, alumni, and LIS-related organizations. The event will be held on the UW Seattle campus and more details will be available on a forthcoming registration page. If you have questions, please email icareers@uw.edu.

-
$15.00 / hour, Part-time



We will be hiring for the following locations:

BFI4 - 21005 64th Avenue S - Kent, WA 98032, kent,  98032
BFI5- 20526 59th Pl S, Kent, WA 98032, Kent,  98032


Requirements

You must be 18 years or older and have a high school diploma or equivalent

How to prepare
Please plan on spending 2 hr at the event. Please bring your necessary documents with you to the event: If you are hired and accept the position, you will need to provide proof of your identity and employment eligibility as required by federal law by completing a Form I-9. Here is a link to the List of Acceptable Document(s) that are needed (either 1 from List A or 1 from List B and 1 from List C): https://www.uscis.gov/i-9-central/acceptable-documents
What to wear
Dress code is Casual (come as you are, but please be presentable).
About the Company

WE RAISED THE BAR ON WAGES
All U.S. employees earn at least $15/hour.

Whether you're looking for part-time, flex or seasonal, we are putting more money in your pocket. See how Amazon can transform your life.

Each Amazon team member is part of the magic of bringing orders to life. We all come together to help make the holidays happen.

Whether you want a career or to earn extra cash now, we offer part-time, seasonal and flexible schedules that work with your life. During the holidays you can flex-up and work additional hours to earn even more.
Want to win an echo dot?
Bring a friend to the hiring event for Part-Time Warehouse position for a chance of winning at our raffle.
 
What is a Hiring Event?
Think of it like a job fair, but for one company and more personal. Hiring events are a great way for employers to fill multiple roles quickly. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to meet you to see if you’re a fit!

jobfair_list.name: 2019 Seattle Sports Marketing Conference & Career Fair
jobfair_list.description:
The Seattle Sports Marketing Conference & Career Fair will be held Sept. 30-Oct. 1, 2019 at the Washington State Convention Center in Seattle. The second annual conference will bring forward some of the top leaders in the sports industry, provide educational opportunities for university students, and career opportunities for those looking to break into the sports world.
Our mission statement is to democratize sports business as a content-driven conference by thought leaders seeking to redefine the industry.
NOTE: In 2018, we had 54 speakers, 50 sessions and sold out our conference & single day passes prior to the show.
Check back continuously to see our updated schedule and speaker list - starting in Feb. 2019, we should have our first tentative list of content and speakers announced.

The Seattle Sports Marketing Conference will have several educational tracks with some of the top speakers in the sports & entertainment industry. Those tracks include:
- Breaking/Working In Sports
- Sports Media/PR/Journalism
- eSports
- Sports Law
- Sports Sustainability/Social Responsibility
- Sports Technology/Analytics
- Sports Marketing/Promotions
- Sports Sponsorship
- Sports Sales Training
- Sports Apparel
- Sports Venues
& more tracks to come.

The 2019 Career Fair will have a "speed dating" career fair with hiring managers from professional teams/organizations around the country. It is an additional fee and participants will have 5-8 minutes per hiring manager to give their personal elevator pitch, answer interview questions, and hand over their resume for a chance to break into the sports industry. We actively seek sports employers with jobs to sit on these engagement sessions.

Conference Book Author & Autograph Program, will provide attendees with access to select sports author readings, engage with the authors afterward as well as the ability to get their books signed at the conference. We've set it up so that you can order their books ahead of the conference, and have them delivered to the conference site, to ease the issue of leaving a book home that you wanted to get signed.

Networking Night provides the ability for young professionals to gain extra time with each other in a casual setting. The actual location(s) are TBA until we get a final head count but will be within the city limits of Seattle.

1-on-1 Mentoring Sessions are set up between students and selected sports business professionals in advance of the conference. This is not just a resume a review. This is about seeking out ways to improve at the sports marketing conference and maximize the results when getting to conference.

Mentor's Lunch is new for 2019 are set up between students and selected sports business professionals in a round table discussion - sharing a meal together (which is included with the ticket price). You want to pick the brain of a professional, this is your opportunity to do so.

FAQs
Can you explain your ticket pricing policy?
We operate on a "you snooze, you lose" policy of ticket pricing, which is broken down for someone to buy a one day pass on either Sept. 30 or Oct. 1, or they can purchase the full conference pass for both dates. There are only a certain amount of tickets per price level, which means that once those tickets are gone, the next price available may be higher. Single day passes start at $10, a conference pass starts at $15, and they go up incrementally based on purchased demand. NOTE: It is wise to purchase your tickets early as the price will not go down or remain static once ticket inventory is all go for a specific price level. This includes add-on items such as the career fair and once inventory for networking nights, autograph alley, etc are gone, they are gone for good.

Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event?
There is no minimum age, however, it is best recommended that below the age of 16, the options for sports career employment will be minimal to start.

What are my transportation/parking options for getting to and from the event?
Complete parking information: https://www.wscc.com/directions

What is on your menu for the conference?
We don't serve food as part of the conference except during the mentor's lunch which is available as an add-on price. You are on your own for eating opportunities. Luckily, the conference is in downtown Seattle, which boasts some of the best food available around it. You will not starve.

Where do I stay for the conference?
We don't have an established hotel... yet - but we are potentially working on it. We find that they typically create cost barriers for conference attendees. Stay where you like. There are about 30 within a mile walking distance of the Washington State Convention Center. If you want to be very affordable, it is suggested that an Airbnb or Extended Stay (i.e. lowest cost) is worth checking into.

What can I bring into the event?
A stack of business cards, resumes, and business attire is recommended.

How can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Troy Kirby - President/CEO, 360-402-1484

How can I receive a deck to sponsor this event?
David Gravenkemper - VP/Partnerships

What's the refund policy?
No refunds to the conference - this makes it fair for our attendees because it is based on demand pricing. You can transfer passes if necessary if you cannot make it. All speakers promoted are scheduled to appear, however Tao of Sports, LLC cannot guarantee specific speakers/specific team executives may not cancel due to unforeseen scheduling conflicts. Tao of Sports, LLC will make every reasonable attempt to broadcast/promote any speaker lineup changes/team executive (additions/subtractions).
